item.title: 1 Fundamentals of Website Rendering
item.description: To display the contents of a website, a browser will typically request HTML, CSS, JavaScript and image content from a server and interpret it based on web standards and specifications. While doing so it uses multiple engines, each with different tasks that it has to complete. For example there is the Layout Engine that reacts to user input e.g. in the URL bar, or there is the Network Layer that handles network functions and all kinds of network requests.
